title: Protocol to isolate and enrich mouse splenic naive CD4+ T cells for in vitro CD4+CD8αα+ cell induction
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
      Naive CD4+ T cell isolation from mouse spleen
    
Timing: 120 min
      The following steps provide the procedure of collection of spleen and
      isolation of naive CD4+ T cells using commercially
      available kit[href=https://www.miltenyibiotec.com/upload/assets/IM0009079.PDF].
    
        Euthanize C57BL/6J mice by cervical dislocation, disinfect with 70%
        ethanol to prevent contamination.
      
        Cut open the abdomen and expose the spleen in the abdominal cavity (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]A).
        
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2040-Fig1.jpg
              Figure 1. Spleen harvesting and naive CD4+ T cell
              enrichment
            
              (A) Euthanize C57BL/6J mice according to the institutional
              guidelines. Collect spleen using scissors and forceps.
            
              (B) Place the spleen in a petri dish containing 5 mL of HBSS
              solution.
            
(C) Place the spleen on a 100 μm cell strainer.
(D) Crush the spleen with a syringe plunger.
              (E) Place LS column in the magnetic field and rinse the column
              with 3 mL of MACS buffer.
            
(F) Collect flow-through containing unlabeled cells.
              (G) Representative gating strategy for analysis of CD45+
              CD4+ cells before enrichment.
            
              (H) FACS plot showing the expression of CD62L and CD44 before or
              after enrichment.
            
        Collect the spleen and place in a petri dish containing 5 mL of HBSS
        solution on ice (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]B).
      
Put a 100 μm cell strainer on top of a 50 mL conical tube.
        Place the spleen on the cell strainer and crush with a syringe plunger
        (Figures 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]C and 1D) (add ice-cold HBSS several times
        to rinse off the cells).
      
        Adjust the volume to 30 mL for each tube with ice-cold HBSS solution.
      
Centrifuge (600 × g, 5 min, at 4°C). Discard supernatant.
        Add 2 mL of 0.84% (vol/wt) ammonium chloride on the cell pellet to
        hemolyze and resuspend by pipetting. Incubate 5 min at RT.
      
        Add 20 mL of ice-cold HBSS solution and centrifuge (600 × g,
        5 min, at 4°C).

Remove supernatant and resuspend cell pellet with 10 mL of HBSS
        solution.
      
        Count cell number and transfer 5 × 107 cells into new 15 mL
        conical tube.
      
        Fill up volume to 10 mL with ice-cold MACS buffer and centrifuge
        (600 × g, 5 min, at 4°C).
      
Resuspend cell pellet in 200 μL of ice-cold MACS buffer.
        Add 50 μL of Biotin-Antibody Cocktail (included in the isolation kit)
        and mix well. Incubate for 5 min in the refrigerator (2°C–8°C).
      
Note: This cocktail contains
      biotin-conjugated monoclonal antibodies against CD8α, CD11b, CD11c, CD19,
      CD25, CD45R (B220), CD49b (DX5), CD105, Anti-MHC class II, Ter-119, and
      TCRγ/δ to remove unwanted immune cells.
    
        Add 100 μL of MACS buffer, 100 μL of Anti-Biotin Microbeads and 50 μL of
        CD44 Microbeads (both are included the isolation kit).
      
Note: By excluding CD44-positive cells in
      addition to non-CD4 cells at this point, only naive CD4+ cells
      can be obtained in a single column operation.
    
Mix well and incubate for 10 min in the refrigerator (2°C–8°C).
        To remove unbound antibodies and microbeads, add 5 mL of ice-cold MACS
        buffer to cell suspension and centrifuge (600 × g, 5 min, at
        4°C).
      
        Place LS column in the MidiMACS separator and rinse the column with 3 mL
        of MACS buffer (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]E).
      
        Resuspend cell pellet with 1 mL of MACS buffer and apply onto the
        column. Collect flow-through containing unlabeled cells, representing
        the enriched naive CD4+ T cells (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]F).
      
Centrifuge (600 × g, 5 min, at 4°C). Discard supernatant.
        Wash with 10 mL of T cell culture medium and centrifuge (600 × g,
        5 min, at 4°C).
      
        Remove supernatant and resuspend cell pellet with 1 mL of T cell medium.
      
        Count cell number and adjust 1 × 105 cells per 50 μL of
        T cell medium.

To check the quality of the purification, take 50 μL of aliquot and
        transfer to 5 mL tubes.
      
        Wash with 200 μL of FACS buffer and Centrifuge (800 × g, 3 min,
        at 4°C).
      
        Discard supernatant and resuspend cells in 50 μL of Fc blocker solution
        (concentration per antibody: 1:200).
      
Incubate cells for 10 min at 4°C.
        Add antibody cocktail (anti-CD45, CD4, CD44 and CD62L, concentration per
        antibody: 1:200) is added to the cells (see
        key resources table[href=https://www.wicell.org#key-resources-table]).
      
Incubate cells for 30 min in the dark at 4°C.
        After incubation, fill up volume to 200 μL with FACS buffer and
        centrifuge (800 × g, 3 min, at 4°C).
      
        Remove supernatant and resuspend cell pellet with 400 μL of FACS buffer.
      
        Analyze cells on a flow cytometer. Representative gating strategy and an
        example of FACS analysis of purification is shown in
        Figures 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]G and 1H.
      
In vitro culture for CD4+CD8αα+ T cell
      induction in normoxic or hypoxic condition
    
Timing: 4 days
      This step describes seeding naive CD4+ T cells and stimulation
      by pre-coated anti-CD3 and soluble anti-CD28 with cytokines to initiate
      differentiation.
    
        Wash pre-coated 96-well flat-bottom plate (see before you begin for
        details) 3 times with DPBS.
        
            Remove coating solution with a suction (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]A).
            
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2040-Fig2.jpg
                  Figure 2. In vitro culture for CD4+CD8αα+
                  T cell induction in normoxic or hypoxic condition
                
(A) Remove coating solution with a suction.
                  (B) Add 100 μL of DPBS to each well using multichannel
                  pipette.
                
                  (C) Place an Anaeropack and culture medium in 50 mL tube in
                  Rectangular jar.
                
                  (D) The medium after 16 h incubation with Anaeropack resulting
                  in hypoxic atmosphere (8%–10% O2).
                
                  (E) Place the airtight container into an incubator at 37°C.
                
            Add 100 μL of DPBS to each well using multichannel pipette (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]B).
          
Remove DPBS with a suction.

Repeat b and c two more times.
            In the end, add 100 μL DPBS to keep the pre-coated bottom wet.
          
Remove DPBS from washed 96-well plate right before use.
        Add 50 μL of enriched naive CD4+ T cell suspension
        (1 × 105 cells) per well onto pre-coated 96-well plate.
      
        Add 50 μL of anti-CD28 solution (final concentration: 1 μg/mL diluted
        with culture medium) to each well.
      
Add 50 μL of mixed cytokine solution to each well.
Add 50 μL of T cell culture medium to fill up volume to 200 μL.
Alternatives: The medium added at
      the end can be a free slot for any compounds or neutralizing antibodies
      you wish to use. In that case, you can prepare four times the
      concentration and add 50 μL to the culture.
    
        Place the cells into an 5% CO2 incubator at 37°C for 4 days.
      
        For the culture in hypoxic condition, use the medium stored in hypoxic
        condition to prepare enriched cells, anti-CD28 solution and mixed
        cytokine solution (Figures 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]C and 2D).
      
        Put the cells in the airtight container with a new Anaeropack and close
        immediately.
      
Critical: Ensure to use newly opened
      Anaeropack at the beginning of the incubation. Use hypoxic medium as soon
      as it is opened.
    
        Place the airtight container into an incubator at 37°C for 4 days (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]E).
      
      Flow cytometric analysis for CD4+CD8αα+ T cell
      differentiation
    
        Harvest all cells (per well) 4 days after the initiation of culture.
      
        Transfer cells into new 96-well U-bottom plate and centrifuge
        (800 × g, 3 min, at 4°C).
      
        Discard supernatant and resuspend the cells in 50 μL of Fc blocker
        solution (see key resources table[href=https://www.wicell.org#key-resources-table]).
      
Incubate cells for 10 min at 4°C.
        Add antibody cocktail (anti-CD45, TCRβ, CD4, CD8α and CD8β,
        concentration per antibody: 1:200 diluted with FACS buffer) to the
        cells.

Alternatives: Dead cell
      contamination can be adequately excluded by gating during the analysis
      process. Although we did not use Live/Dead cell staining in this protocol,
      dead cells can be more reliably excluded if used.
    
Incubate cells for 30 min in the dark at 4°C.
        After incubation, fill up volume to 200 μL with FACS buffer and
        centrifuge (800 × g, 3 min, at 4°C).
      
        Discard supernatant and resuspend the cells in 100 μL of fixation buffer
        (included in Foxp3/transcription factor staining buffer set, see
        key resources table[href=https://www.wicell.org#key-resources-table]).
      
Incubate cells for 30 min in the dark at 4°C.
Centrifuge the cells (800 × g, 3 min, at 4°C).
        Discard supernatant and resuspend the cells in 200 μL of
        permeabilization buffer (included in Foxp3/transcription factor staining
        buffer set, see key resources table[href=https://www.wicell.org#key-resources-table]).
      
Centrifuge the cells (800 × g, 3 min, at 4°C).
        Discard supernatant and resuspend the cells in 50 μL of anti-Foxp3
        solution (concentration: 1:100) diluted with permeabilization buffer.
      
Incubate cells for 1 h in the dark at 4°C.
Centrifuge the cells (800 × g, 3 min, at 4°C).
        Discard supernatant and resuspend the cells in 200 μL of FACS buffer.
      
        Transfer cells into 5 mL tubes and fill up volume to 400 μL with FACS
        buffer.
      
        Acquire cells on a flow cytometer and analyze data using FlowJo software
        (Representative gating strategy and results in
        Figures 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig3]A–3C).
